required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SATIN WP4 Acute Effect on Appetite of Pineapple Juice With Viscofiber and Red Ginseng
clinical_study.official_title: SATIN WP4 - The Acute Effect on Appetite of Pineapple Juice With Viscofiber and Red Ginseng

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to establish whether a Pineapple juice with Viscofiber and Red ginseng can enhance satiety and reduce appetite and/or accelerate satiation in the short-term.

detailed_description.textblock: A double-blind, randomised crossover design will be employed with an experimental (active) condition and a control condition at least one week apart. After having successfully completed screening procedures eligible participants will be invited for two separate test days, at least 7 days apart. On the two test days, the products will be provided in a randomized order as part of a fixed breakfast meal, and subjective appetite ratings will be measured every 30 min for the following 8 hours. Satiety and satiation will be measured through administration of test meals in the laboratory supplied with controlled food intake under free-living conditions

primary_outcome.description: Total ad libitum energy intake during test day 1
Total ad libitum energy intake during test day 2

secondary_outcome.measure: VAS score for appetite sensation - hunger
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 30 min during test day 1 and test day 2
secondary_outcome.description: Perceptions of hunger, assessed using 100 mm VAS scales

secondary_outcome.measure: Eating behaviour questionnaire - binge eating scale
Eating behaviour questionnaire - Control of Eating
Eating behaviour questionnaire - three factor eating questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Three Factor Eating Questionnaire by Stunkard and Messick, 1985

secondary_outcome.measure: Eating behaviour questionnaire- power of food
secondary_outcome.description: Power of food scale by Lowe et al 2009

secondary_outcome.measure: VAS score for appetite sensation - fullness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 min during test day 1 and test day 2
secondary_outcome.description: Perceptions of fullness, assessed using 100 mm VAS scales

secondary_outcome.measure: VAS score for appetite sensation - Desire to eat
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 min during test day 1 and test day 2
secondary_outcome.description: Perceptions of Desire to eat, assessed using 100 mm VAS scales

secondary_outcome.measure: VAS score for appetite sensation - prospective consumption
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 min during test day 1 and test day 2
secondary_outcome.description: Perceptions of prospective suncumption, assessed using 100 mm VAS scales

arm_group.description: Satin pineapple. Active juice with fibre and ginseng
SATIN pineapple control. Control juice - normal juice prpoducts without added active ingredients

intervention.description: Active juice with added fibre and ginseng

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants who have provided written informed consent
- Healthy men and women
- Ages between 18 and 55 years
- BMI between 25.0-31.9 kg/m2
- Regular breakfast eaters (eating breakfast ≥ 4 times a week)
- Regular menstrual periods (women only)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant health problems as judged by the investigator
- Taking any medication or supplements known to affect appetite or body weight within the past month and/or during the study as judged by the investigator
- Pregnant, planning to become pregnant within the next 4 weeks or breastfeeding (women only)
- History of anaphylaxis to food
- Any known food allergies or food intolerance
- Smoking, smoking cessation within the past 3 months or nicotine use (electronic cigarettes)
- Self-reporting currently dieting or having lost/gained significant amount of weight (±3 kg) in the previous 3 months
- Significant changes in physical activity patterns in the past 4 weeks or intention to change during the study as judged by the investigator
- Significant change in diet in the past 4 weeks or intention to change the diet during the study as judged by the investigator
- Use of systemic or local treatment likely to interfere with evaluation of the study parameters as judged by the investigator
- Participants who work in appetite or feeding related areas
- Participants not able to comply with the study protocol
- Post-menopausal (women only)

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Anders Mikael Sjödin, MD, PHD ass professor
